us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class LineSegment2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.LineSegment2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LineSegment2DBasics, LineSegment2DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<LineSegment2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<LineSegment2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<LineSegment2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<LineSegment2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable

    public class LineSegment2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements LineSegment2DBasics, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<LineSegment2D>
    Represents a finite-length 2D line segment defined by its two 2D endpoints.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LineSegment2D()
      Default constructor that initializes both endpoints of this line segment to zero.
      LineSegment2D(double firstEndpointX, double firstEndpointY, double secondEndpointX, double secondEndpointY)
      Initializes this line segment to have the given endpoints.
      LineSegment2D(LineSegment2D other)
      Creates a new line segment 2D and initializes it to other.
      LineSegment2D(LineSegment2DReadOnly other)
      Creates a new line segment 2D and initializes it to other.
      LineSegment2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly firstEndpoint, us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly secondEndpoint)
      Initializes this line segment to have the given endpoints.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean epsilonEquals(LineSegment2D other, double epsilon)
      Tests on a per-component basis on both endpoints if this line segment is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
      Tests if the given object's class is the same as this, in which case the method returns LineSegment2DReadOnly.equals(LineSegment2DReadOnly), it returns false otherwise.
      boolean geometricallyEquals(LineSegment2D other, double epsilon)
      Compares this to other to determine if the two line segments are geometrically similar.
      us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics getFirstEndpoint()
      Gets the reference to the first endpoint of this line segment.
      us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics getSecondEndpoint()
      Gets the reference to the second endpoint of this line segment.
      int hashCode()
      Calculates and returns a hash code value from the value of each component of this line segment 2D.
      void set(LineSegment2D other)
      Sets this line segment to be same as the given line segment.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Provides a String representation of this line segment 2D as follows:
      Line segment 2D: 1st endpoint = (x, y), 2nd endpoint = (x, y)

      • epsilonEquals

        public boolean epsilonEquals(LineSegment2D other,
                             double epsilon)
        Tests on a per-component basis on both endpoints if this line segment is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon.
        Specified by:
        epsilonEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<LineSegment2D>
        Parameters:

        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two line segments are equal, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(LineSegment2D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two line segments are geometrically similar.

        The comparison is based on comparing the line segments' endpoints. Two line segments are considered geometrically equal even if they are defined with opposite direction.

        Specified by:
        geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<LineSegment2D>
        Parameters:
        other - the line segment to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two line segments represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
